element.name: Boon of Attunement
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your attunement slots increase by 1.

element.name: Boon of Beasts
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of speak with animals, and can cast animal friendship at will without any components or expending a spell slot. You lose this effect for 24 hours if you kill a beast.

element.name: Boon of Bond
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You and another willing creature become permanently bonded together by a magical connection. Any damage taken or healing done to either creature is split between the two creatures. Either creature can transfer their hit points to the other creature by touching them as an action if the other creature has less hit points than they do (up to an amount that would equalize their hit points).

element.name: Boon of Carnage
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: When you kill a creature with a weapon attack, you gain 5 temporary hit points and an additional action which can only be used to take the attack action (one weapon attack only) this additional action lasts until the end of your turn. Once you gain this bonus, you cannot gain it again until the start of your next turn.

element.name: Boon of Celestial Ascension
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes Celestial. You gain resistance to radiant damage, and sprout angelic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet. If you already have resistance to radiant damage, you gain immunity to radiant damage.

element.name: Resist Radiant
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to radiant damage.

element.name: Boon of Crafting
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain advantage on all crafting checks or ability checks made with artisan tools.

element.name: Boon of Divine Blessing
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of the bless spell.

element.name: Boon of Divine Guidance
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of the guidance spell. The spell does not end when you make an ability check.

element.name: Boon of Draconic Inheritance (Acid)
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes dragon. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage (selected by the creature giving you the boon), and sprout draconic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

element.name: Boon of Draconic Inheritance (Cold)
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes dragon. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage (selected by the creature giving you the boon), and sprout draconic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

element.name: Boon of Draconic Inheritance (Fire)
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes dragon. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage (selected by the creature giving you the boon), and sprout draconic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

element.name: Boon of Draconic Inheritance (Lightning)
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes dragon. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage (selected by the creature giving you the boon), and sprout draconic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

element.name: Boon of Draconic Inheritance (Poison)
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes dragon. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison damage (selected by the creature giving you the boon), and sprout draconic wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet.

element.name: Boon of Demonic Transformation
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes fiend (demon). You gain resistance to fire and lightning damage. You sprout a demonic tail that can be used as a natural weapon, dealing 1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 poison damage.
If you already have resistance to fire or lightning or damage, you gain immunity to the damage type.

element.name: Resist Fire
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to fire damage.

element.name: Resist Lightning
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to lightning damage.

element.name: Boon of Earth
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain resistance to poison damage and gain a tremorsense of 30 feet. You can cast become stone at will without any components or expending a spell slot.
If you are already resistant to poison damage, you gain immunity to poison damage.

element.name: Resist Poison
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to poison damage.

element.name: Boon of Everlasting Magic
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: The duration of all your spells with a duration is doubled.

element.name: Boon of Fire
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain resistance to fire damage and no longer suffer the effects of hot environments. You can cast become fire at will without any components or expending a spell slot.
If you already have resistance to fire damage, you gain immunity to fire damage.

element.name: Boon of Freezing Water
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain resistance to cold damage and no longer suffer the effects of cold environments. You can cast become water at will without any components or expending a spell slot.
If you already have resistance to cold damage, you gain immunity to cold damage.

element.name: Resist Cold
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to cold damage.

element.name: Boon of Illusions
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You can cast silent image at will without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you can see through all illusions, seeing them for what they are.

element.name: Boon of Infernal Damnation
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes fiend (devil). You gain resistance to fire and poison damage. You sprout infernal horns.
f you already have resistance to fire or poison damage, they gain immunity to the damage type.

element.name: Boon of The Fairy
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You become one size smaller. You can cast faerie fire at will without any components or expending a spell slot. You gain butterfly wings that grant you a flying speed of 30 feet, but leave behind an ephemeral trail of glittering dust when you fly that lasts one round, giving you disadvantage on stealth checks when on any turn you use your flying speed.

element.name: Boon of The Giant
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your size increases to Large (if smaller than Large), and the damage of your melee weapon attacks increase by 1d4.

element.name: Boon of Ghostly Passage
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: As a bonus action, you can become ethereal until the start of your next turn. While ethereal, you can pass through creatures and objects without expending additional movement, but cannot end your turn inside an occupied space. You have resistance to all damage besides force and psychic damage. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this effect ends, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

element.name: Boon of Martial Vigor
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: All expended active martial feats you have gain a "Recharge (6)" ability, meaning that at the start of each of your turns, you roll a d6 for each one. On a 6, they are refreshed immediately.
Active Martial Feats are feats that give you a short rest based power.

element.name: Boon of Mercy
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Whenever you restore hit points to another creature, you gain temporary hit points equal to the number of hit points restored.

element.name: Boon of Misfortune
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: A twisted boon that doesn't negate your bad luck, but lets you share it. Whenever you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, you can choose a creature within 60 feet. Their d20 next roll before the start of your next turn becomes a 1.

element.name: Boon of Pacifism
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of sanctuary. Any action that would normally break it still breaks it, but you regain the effect if you go 1 minute without taking an action that would break it.
Additionally, you gain the ability to cast calm emotions without any components or expending a spell slot once, regaining the ability to do so again after completing a short or long rest.

element.name: Boon of Quicksilver Steps
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: As a reaction to being attacked or making a Dexterity saving throw, you can add your proficiency bonus to your AC or saving throw result. When you do so, you can move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
Once you use this, you cannot use it again until you end your turn without moving more than 5 feet.

element.name: Boon of Sacrifice
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: As an action, you can touch a creature and transfer it a number of your hit points up to twice your character level. You cannot reduce your own hit points below 1 when transferring hit points this way

element.name: Boon of Shadows
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: While in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action as a bonus action. When you take Hide action in dim light or darkness, you become invisible until take another action, deal damage, cast a spell, or are no longer in dim light or darkness.

element.name: Boon of the Brute
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You can add your Strength modifier to your Wisdom, Intelligence, and Charisma saving throws.

element.name: Boon of the Chosen Hero
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of the heroism spell.

element.name: Boon of Time
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to cast time stop without expending a spell slot. When you cast it this way, it stops time for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus instead of rolling. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

element.name: Boon of Undeath
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your creature type becomes undead. You gain resistance to necrotic damage. You no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe. Additionally, if you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken. On success, your are reduced to 1 hit point instead.
If you already have resistance to necrotic damage, you become immune to necrotic damage instead.

element.name: Resist Necrotic
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

element.name: Boon of Wind
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain resistance to lightning damage and no longer take fall damage from falling. You can cast become wind at will without any components or expending a spell slot.
If you already have resistance to lightning damage, you gain immunity to lightning damage.

element.name: Boon of the Spiderqueen
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your lower half becomes that of a spider. You are permanently under the effect of the spider climb spell and you can ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing. You deal an additional 1d4 poison damage on any weapon attack (including unarmed strikes or natural weapons) you make.
You can cast the web spell without components or expending a spell slot once, after which you must complete a short or long rest to cast it this way again.

element.name: Boon of Babble
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You can understand, speak, and read all languages

element.name: Boon of Bounding
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your long and high jumping distance is doubled.

element.name: Boon of Coins
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Each month, the amount of any coin you own or have stored increases by five percent. This property ceases to functions for that month if the coins are carefully observed during that time.

element.name: Boon of Doggos
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: All dogs treat you as a friendly creature. You lose this boon if your alignment ever becomes neutral or evil.

element.name: Boon of Divine Light
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You can emit 15 feet of bright light, and an additional 15 feet of dim light. The bright light is sunlight. You can douse or relight this light at any time without using an action.

element.name: Boon of Endless Masks
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to cast disguise self at will. The spell lasts until you dismiss it when you cast it this way

element.name: Boon of Fair Winds
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: The wind always blows in a favorable direction while you are sailing on the water.

element.name: Boon of Heavy Hands
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your unarmed strikes become considered natural weapons having the Heavy property, and their damage increases to 1d8. If you are Small, you ignore the disadvantage imposed by the Heavy property for unarmed strikes.

element.name: Boon of Inventory
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain a sub-dimensional space allowing you to store up to items in space roughly 64 cubic feet. As an action, you can place an item that you can carry into this space, or retrieve an item that is already in the space. You cannot place living things into this space. The passage of time does not affect items stored in this inventory.

element.name: Boon of Iron
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain proficiency in all armor and weapons.

element.name: Boon of Ink
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Copying spells into your spellbook, spellmanual, or similar record of spells no longer costs gold.

element.name: Boon of Open Mind
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain telepathy, which you can use to communicate with other creatures within 60 feet of you. You do not need to share a language, but a creature must speak at least one language to understand you. The creatures reply to messages sent this way.

element.name: Boon of Plenty
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to cast goodberry without expending a spell slot. Berries created this way are particularly delicious. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

element.name: Boon of Steady Hands
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Being drunk no longer gives you disadvantage on attack rolls or ability checks.

element.name: Boon of Swiftness
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

element.name: Boon of Talent
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain proficiency in one skill of the entity granting the boonâ€™s choice. If you are already proficient in that skill, you gain expertise in the skill.

element.name: Boon of the Dancer
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws, and all ability checks involving dancing. When you dance, special effects based on the granter of the boon may appear (such as rays of moonlight).

element.name: Boon of the Familiar
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to cast find familiar without any components or expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

element.name: Boon of the Phoenix
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: The first time you would die after receiving this boon, you are instead consumed by a pillar of flames shaped like a phoenix. In this fire you are healed for a number of hit points equal to your maximum and release a wave of fire hitting all creatures within 20 feet. Hostile creatures in range of the fire must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save. Allied creatures in range of the fire are instead healed for 4d6 hit points.
After this boon is triggered, you lose this boon.

element.name: Boon of the Sea
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to breathe underwater, and gain a swimming speed equal to walking speed.

element.name: Boon of the Shroud
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You are permanently under the effect of nondetection, though the effect can be pierced by any entity of greater power than one that granted this boon.

element.name: Boon of the Steed
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain the ability to cast find steed without any components or expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

element.name: Boon of the Twisted Tongue
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Insight checks and spells cannot reveal your deceptions or compel you to speak the truth, unless they are performed by an entity of greater power than the one that granted you the boon. This does not mean that creatures automatically believe you, or that your lies cannot be revealed by other means (such as context, logic, or evidence).

element.name: Boon of Tiny Might
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: Being small or tiny no longer imposes disadvantage when using weapons with the Heavy property.

element.name: Boon of Twilight
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain darkvision out to a range of 300 feet.

element.name: Boon of Youth
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You cease to visually age, and can even choose to become more youthful in appearance, though your lifespan remains the natural lifespan of your race.

element.name: Boon of Vengeance
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Legends and Legacies

description.p: You gain advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks against one specific creature (defined by the entity granting the bond).
